long: Meaning: "alive"; hence, "raw" (flesh); "fresh" (plant, water, year), "strong"; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) "life" (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively.  Usage:   age, alive, appetite, (wild) beast, company, congregation, life(-time), live(-ly), living (creature, thing), maintenance,   merry, multitude,   (be) old, quick, raw, running, springing, troop.  Source: from "H2421";
